channel.title: Location on SoftLayer API
channel.description: Recent content in Location on SoftLayer API

item.title: SoftLayer_Location
item.description: SoftLayer_Location Service Datatype Description The SoftLayer_Location API service queries SoftLayer’s location tree to find locations for all softlayer resources including bare metal servers, virtual servers, storage repositories, datacenters, points of presence, network backbones, and many more. Methods getActivePresaleEvents getAvailableObjectStorageDatacenters Get the datacenters where object storage is available getBackboneDependents getDatacenters Retrieve all datacenter locations getDatacentersWithVirtualImageStoreServiceResourceRecord getEuCompliantFlag Retrieve a flag indicating whether or not the datacenter/location is EU compliant.

item.title: SoftLayer_Location_Datacenter
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Datacenter Service Datatype Description SoftLayer_Location_Datacenter exposes functionality to access datacenter-specific portions of SoftLayer’s backend network. SoftLayer maintains datacenters within it’s location hierarchy. Datacenters are located in city locations and each contain server room locations, racks, then slots. Each slot location houses a piece of SoftLayer hardware. seeAlso SoftLayer_Location Methods getActiveItemPresaleEvents getActivePresaleEvents getAvailableObjectStorageDatacenters Get the datacenters where object storage is available getBackboneDependents getBackendHardwareRouters getBoundSubnets Retrieve subnets which are directly bound to one or more routers in a given datacenter, and currently allow routing.

item.title: SoftLayer_Location_Group
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Group Service Datatype Description Methods getAllObjects getLocationGroupType Retrieve the type for this location group. getLocations Retrieve the locations in a group. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Location_Group record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Location_Group_Pricing
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Group_Pricing Service Datatype Description A pricing location group relates a set of [[SoftLayer_Product_Item_Price|prices]] to only be available to a set of [[SoftLayer_Location|locations]] when used for [[SoftLayer_Product_Order|ordering]]. Methods getAllObjects Get all pricing location groups. getLocationGroupType Retrieve the type for this location group. getLocations Retrieve the locations that this pricing location group is applicable for. This limits the locations that the prices referenced by this pricing location group can be used with.

item.title: SoftLayer_Location_Group_Regional
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Group_Regional Service Datatype Description A regional location group is a collection of datacenters for a region. Methods getAllObjects Get all regional groups. getDatacenters Retrieve the datacenters in a group. getLocationGroupType Retrieve the type for this location group. getLocations Retrieve the locations in a group. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Location_Group_Regional record. getPreferredDatacenter Retrieve the preferred datacenters of a group.

item.title: SoftLayer_Location_Reservation
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Reservation Service Datatype Description Methods getAccount Retrieve the account that a billing item belongs to. getAccountReservations getAllotment Retrieve the bandwidth allotment that the reservation belongs to. getBillingItem Retrieve the bandwidth allotment that the reservation belongs to. getLocation Retrieve the datacenter location that the reservation belongs to. getLocationReservationRack Retrieve rack information for the reservation getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Location_Reservation record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Location_Reservation_Rack
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Reservation_Rack Service Datatype Description Methods getAllotment Retrieve the bandwidth allotment that the reservation belongs to. getChildren Retrieve members of the rack. getLocation getLocationReservation getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Location_Reservation_Rack record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Location_Reservation_Rack_Member
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Reservation_Rack_Member Service Datatype Description Methods getLocation Retrieve location relation for the rack member getLocationReservationRack getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Location_Reservation_Rack_Member record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Location
item.description: SoftLayer_Location Service Datatype Description Every piece of hardware and network connection owned by SoftLayer is tracked physically by location and stored in the SoftLayer_Location data type. SoftLayer locations exist in parent/child relationships, a convenient way to track equipment from it’s city, datacenter, server room, rack, then slot. Network backbones are tied to datacenters only, not to a room, rack, or slot. associatedMethods SoftLayer_Hardware::getLocation SoftLayer_Hardware::getDatacenter SoftLayer_Network_Backbone::getLocation Local id The unique identifier of a specific location.

item.title: SoftLayer_Location
item.description: SoftLayer_Location Service Datatype Description Every piece of hardware and network connection owned by SoftLayer is tracked physically by location and stored in the SoftLayer_Location data type. SoftLayer locations exist in parent/child relationships, a convenient way to track equipment from it’s city, datacenter, server room, rack, then slot. Network backbones are tied to datacenters only, not to a room, rack, or slot. Local euCompliantFlag Type: boolean

Type: integer longName A longer location description. Type: string name A short location description. Type: string statusId Type: integer

item.title: SoftLayer_Location_Region
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Region Datatype Description A region is made up of a keyname and a description of that region. A region keyname can be used as part of an order. Check the SoftLayer_Product_Order service for more details. associatedMethods SoftLayer_Product_Order::verifyOrder SoftLayer_Product_Order::placeOrder Local description A short description of a region's name. This description is seen on the order forms. Type: string keyname A unique key name for a region.

item.title: SoftLayer_Location_Region
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Region Datatype Description A region is made up of a keyname and a description of that region. A region keyname can be used as part of an order. Check the SoftLayer_Product_Order service for more details. Local description A short description of a region's name. This description is seen on the order forms. Type: string keyname A unique key name for a region.

item.title: SoftLayer_Location_Region_Location
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Region_Location Datatype Description The SoftLayer_Location_Region_Location is very specific to the location where services will actually be provisioned. When accessed through a package, this location is the top priority location for a region. All new servers and services are provisioned at this location. When a server is ordered and a region is selected, this is the location within that region where the server will actually exist and have software/services installed.

item.title: SoftLayer_Location_Region_Location
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Region_Location Datatype Description The SoftLayer_Location_Region_Location is very specific to the location where services will actually be provisioned. When accessed through a package, this location is the top priority location for a region. All new servers and services are provisioned at this location. When a server is ordered and a region is selected, this is the location within that region where the server will actually exist and have software/services installed.

item.title: SoftLayer_Location_Status
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Status Datatype Description SoftLayer_Location_Status models the state of any location. SoftLayer uses the following status codes: *“‘ACTIVE”’: The location is currently active and available for public usage. *“‘PLANNED”’: Used when a location is planned but not yet active. *“‘RETIRED”’: Used when a location has been retired and no longer active. Locations in use should stay in the ACTIVE state. If a locations status ever reads anything else and contains active hardware then please contact SoftLayer support.

item.title: SoftLayer_Location_Status
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Status Datatype Description SoftLayer_Location_Status models the state of any location. SoftLayer uses the following status codes: *“‘ACTIVE”’: The location is currently active and available for public usage. *“‘PLANNED”’: Used when a location is planned but not yet active. *“‘RETIRED”’: Used when a location has been retired and no longer active. Locations in use should stay in the ACTIVE state. If a locations status ever reads anything else and contains active hardware then please contact SoftLayer support.

item.title: getBrandCountryRestrictions
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Datacenter::getBrandCountryRestrictions Retrieve this references relationship between brands, locations and countries associated with a user’s account that are ineligible when ordering products. For example, the India datacenter may not be available on this brand for customers that live in Great Britain. Overview Retrieve this references relationship between brands, locations and countries associated with a user’s account that are ineligible when ordering products. For example, the India datacenter may not be available on this brand for customers that live in Great Britain.

item.title: getStatisticsGraphImage
item.description: SoftLayer_Location_Datacenter::getStatisticsGraphImage Retrieve a graph of a SoftLayer datacenter’s last 48 hours of network activity. Overview Retrieve a graph of a SoftLayer datacenter’s last 48 hours of network activity. Statistics graphs show traffic outbound from a datacenter on top and inbound traffic on the bottom followed by a legend of the network services tracked in the graph. getStatisticsGraphImage returns a PNG image of variable width and height depending on the number of services reported in the image.
